goldImageAccess.description: This is a cummulative status of all the gold image access requests for the provider account. The precedence order is Requested > Granted > Failed.

providerAccountID.description: Unique identifier of the cloud provider account.

shortName.description: Short name of the cloud provider e.g. AWS, MSAZ, GCE.

EntitlementsAttached.description: Details of all the entitlements attached and their status.

ErrorDetails.description: ErrorDetails details the Error in ErrorResponse

EusProductList.title: List of RHEL EUS product-repo mappings

goldImages.description: List of gold images available for the provider

description.description: Descriptive name of the gold image

Manifest.title: Manifest is an entity that consumes entitlements. Also referred as a Distributor.

PoolDetail.description: PoolDetail is an entry in the system/allocation pools listing

SystemPurposeAttributes.description: System purpose settings available to an organization

info.description: API for Red Hat Subscription Management
info.title: RHSM-API

get.description: Returns a list of activation keys on the account including service level, role, additionalRepositories, usage, and release version (if applicable). Additional Repositories and release version will be an empty set in case it is not set.

post.description: Creates an activation key by name, release version and system purpose attributes, that are service level, role and usage. In the request body, "name" should be present and unique and can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, or hyphens. The response will have name and additionalRepositories as fixed fields. AdditionalRepositories field will always be empty for a new activation key. Role, serviceLevel, usage, releaseVersion and description are conditional fields, will be present in response only when they have values.

name.description: Name should be present, unique and can only contain letters, numbers, underscores, or hyphens

delete.description: Removes the activation key from the account based on activation key name

put.description: Updates an existing activation key with one or more fields as provided in request. It also returns additionalRepositories field which will be empty set when it is empty

delete.description: Removes the additional repositories from an activation key by providing activation key name and repository labels

post.description: Add additional repositories to an activation key by providing activation key name and repository labels. Customers can use any respositories listed in the `/v2/activation_keys/{name}/available_repositories` endpoint (use attribute `repositoryLabel`). Empty value is not supported and maximum length of repository label allowed is upto 255 characters.

get.description: Returns the list of RPM repositories available to an activation key that can be added as an additional repository. Available repositories are calculated by negating the additional repositories from the set of total RPM repositories. It can be an empty set if there are no RPM repositories or all of the repositories are already added to an activation key.

parameters.description: max number of results you want
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index from which you want next items
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Filters available repos based off default status
parameters.name: default

parameters.description: Repository name to search by
parameters.name: repo_name

parameters.description: Repository label to search by
parameters.name: repo_label

parameters.description: Comma separated list of architectures to search by
parameters.name: architecture

parameters.description: Field to search by. Supported options are repo_name and repo_label. Must be used in combination with sort_direction
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Direction to sort available repositories by. Supported options are asc and desc. Must be used in combination with sort_by
parameters.name: sort_direction

parameters.description: Comma separated list of rpm types to filter by
parameters.name: rpm_type

get.description: Returns the list of provider accounts for an organization.

parameters.description: Max number of results you want. Default limit is 100.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Index from which you want next items. Default offset is 0.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Filter the result by provider short name. Supported values are AWS, MSAZ, GCE (case insensitive).
parameters.name: shortName

parameters.description: Filter the result by provider account ID. API supports case insensitive partial matching.
parameters.name: providerAccountID

parameters.description: Filter the result by gold image access status. Supported values are Requested, Granted, Failed (case insensitive).
parameters.name: goldImageAccess

parameters.description: Sort the result based on the specifc field. Supported values are providerAccountID, shortName, goldImageAccess, dateAdded.
parameters.name: sort_by

parameters.description: Sort the result by the specific direction. Supported values are asc, desc (case insensitive).
parameters.name: sort_direction

body.description: List of unique cloud accounts under the organization.

get.description: Returns the list of gold images available for an organization based on its Red Hat subscriptions/SKUs. If no SKUs are found for the organization, an empty response is returned. Supported providers are AWS, Microsoft Azure and Google Compute Engine.

The default and max number of results in a response are 100.
Satellite 6.0 or higher versions are only supported.

parameters.description: max number of results you want
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: index from which you want next items
parameters.name: offset

get.summary: List all manifests for a user

post.description:
Create Manifest by name and version(optional).
Customers can use any version listed in the `/v2/manifests/versions`
endpoint (use attribute `value`).
If no version is specified, it will take the latest available version
 for Manifest.

parameters.description: must be less than 100 characters and use only numbers, letters, underscores, hyphens, and periods
parameters.name: Name

get.description: Returns list of Satellite version 6.0 and above

delete.description:
The default success response will be 204

System, RHUI, Hypervisor, SAM are unsupported manifet types

parameters.description:
Deleting a subscription manifest can have significant impacts on your hosts and activation keys.
We require a force parameter to make sure the delete operation is intentional.
parameters.name: force

get.description: System, RHUI, Hypervisor, SAM are unsupported manifest types

parameters.description: Show more details about a manifest
parameters.name: include

put.description:
Allows to update simpleContentAccess for Satellite of version 6.3 and
above
Possible value for simpleContentAccess are:

- enabled
- disabled

get.description:
Starts job to generate export for a manifest. To check the status of the export job visit the href in the response.

Satellite 6.0 or higher versions are only supported.

Success response contains a zip file. The link is one-time download and expires after one try. Trigger export job to get another download link.

Content-Type: application/zip
Returns export download link in response.

202.description: AcceptedExportJob202 is a response for accepted and in progress job

get.description: Show Simple Content Access details of user's organization

parameters.description: Request for system purpose attributes in response
parameters.name: include

get.summary: Get details of the user's organization

get.description: Get list of all the products of user's subscription. The products are from subscriptions that have not expired or expired within last 30 days.

parameters.description: Filters products based on subscription status
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Request additional attributes per product in response
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: Filters products based on the comma separated list of engineering product oids passed. When multiple values are passed, the products matching with all the oids  within their providedProducts will be returned
parameters.name: oids

get.summary: List all the products from user's subscription

get.description: Returns the list of currently supported RHEL product-repo mappings for Extended Update Support
Returns the list of currently supported RHEL versions for Extended Update Support
Export a csv file of all subscriptions
